phrase.item: This story is about a golden saddle.
Back in his time, King Iskander commanded that whoever turned 70 years old, whether a man or a woman, should be fed with seven days’ portions of food and then should be buried alive.
Such an order he gave.
So then every day, in turn, each [time] an old man and an old woman
were given seven days’ portions of food at one time and buried alive.
At that time, there was a family who didn't bury their father and hid him.
Nobody was aware of what they had done.
One day King Iskander went for a journey.
He saw a big ocean.
There was a mountain of sheer rock next to the ocean. That rocky mountain was very high.
On top of the mountain was a [horse's] saddle.
That saddle was golden, and the golden saddle was reflected in the water.
It looked as if gold was in the middle of the ocean.
So at that time King Iskander gathered all the young people
and said, “Now each one of you will take a turn, go and bring me the gold from inside the middle of the ocean.
Whoever brings that to me I will give some of my wealth to him.”
All the young people agreed.
At that time King Iskander, whoever he sent — they drowned in the ocean [never to return]. The water was very deep.
Then came the turn of the family who had hid their father.
They went and told their father.
They said, "Oh father, what should we do?
We won't be able to take out the [gold], the ocean is very deep.
All these people have died."
Then their father said, "If you listen to me, that is the reflection from the rocky mountain.
The saddle is up on top of the mountain.
You go climb up that mountain and bring it down from there, and give it to the king.”
His children followed what their father said.
They took a crossbow and rifle with them and climbed up the mountain of sheer rock.
As the mountain was very high, they could not reach the saddle.
Then they shot upwards from down where they were.
Their shot hit the saddle, and it fell down in front of them.
They took it and brought to King Iskander. The king was surprised and said, "How did you know that the saddle wasn't inside the water, but on top of the mountain of sheer rock?"
Then they said, "Before telling you the reason [secret], would you forgive us for something?"
As Iskander was very happy,
from his gladness he said, "Yes, I will forgive you, whatever you say".
The children said, "At that moment when you ordered, that old men and women turning 70 must be killed,
we did not kill our father, we hid him.
Nobody was aware of our secret".
King Iskander said, "For that sin, I am supposed to kill you all,
but as you made my wish come true, whatever you said, I forgive you".
So at that moment the king Iskander kept his promise.
From his wealth he gave some to the children.
Then he let them go, and they left.
Because of that there is a phrase, “Don't go without the elders, or you will be behind [fail at what you do]. It doesn’t matter how much you are the Iskandar of your time!”
